(Simplified: 钒)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 凡 indicates the sound; 釒 (metal) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 凡 [ fán ] any, every, all; common, ordinary
①一種金屬元素，銀白色。
釩鉀鈾礦石 [ fán jiǎ yóu kuàng shí ]: carnotite

釩字的基本解释

釩
fán
见“钒”。

釩字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fǎn］
［《廣韻》峯犯切，上范，敷。］
“钒1”的繁体字。
(1)拂。
(2)作人名用字。明有朱諟钒。见《明史·伊王朱传》。
[②]［fán］
“钒2”的繁体字。
金属元素。符号V。银白色，在常温中不易氧化。钒与钢的合金叫钒钢，工业上用途很广。

釩字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　釩； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页1296第20
【廣韻】【集韻】?峰范切，音䟪。【玉篇】拂也。　又【集韻】器也。　又【集韻】孚梵切，音泛。杯也。

vanadium
Basic explanation of words
vanadium
fán
See "Vanadium".
vanadium
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fǎn］
["Guangyun" peak offense cut, go fan, apply. ]
"Vanadium 1" in traditional characters.
(1) Whisk.
(2) Use words for names. There is Zhu Yunvana in Ming Dynasty. See "Ming Dynasty·Yi Wang Zhu's Biography".
[②]［fán］
"Vanadium 2" in traditional characters.
metal element. Symbol V. Silver white, not easy to oxidize at room temperature. The alloy of vanadium and steel is called vanadium steel, which is widely used in industry.
vanadium
